message.content:
The past perfect continuous tense is formed by using the auxiliary verb "had" plus "been" and the main verb in its "-ing" form. This tense indicates an ongoing action that was completed at a specific time in the past.

Examples:

1) I had been living on my own for six years before I got married.
2) She had been studying English for two years before she went to Australia.
3) James had been working as a cashier before he became assistant manager.
